nearbyList.name: Disabled Am. Vets K-R Metro Chp. No.1
John R King Academic & Performing Arts

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
(A) PHYSICAL FACILITIES shall be cleaned as often as necessary to keep them clean.
(B) Except spill cleanup, cleaning shall be done during periods when the least amount of FOOD is exposed such as after closing.

A) A PLUMBING SYSTEM shall be designed, constructed, and installed according to LAW*. (P)
B) A PLUMBING FIXTURE such as a HANDWASHING SINK, toilet, or urinal shall be EASILY CLEANABLE.
UTENSILS and FOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of EQUIPMENT shall be SANITIZED before use after cleaning. (P)

FOOD EMPLOYEES shall clean their hands in a HANDWASHING SINK or APPROVED automatic handwashing facility and may not clean their hands in a sink used for FOOD preparation or WAREWASHING, or in a service sink or a curbed cleaning facility used for the disposal of mop water and similar liquid waste. (Pf)

(A) PHYSICAL FACILITIES shall be cleaned as often as necessary to keep them clean.
(B) Except spill cleanup, cleaning shall be done during periods when the least amount of FOOD is exposed such as after closing.

REFUSE, recyclables, and returnables shall be removed from the PREMISES at a frequency that will minimize the development of objectionable odors and other conditions that attract or harbor insects and rodents.

A PLUMBING SYSTEM shall be:
(A) Repaired according to LAW; (P) and
(B) Maintained in good repair.
NonFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES shall be free of unnecessary ledges, projections, and crevices, and designed and constructed to allow easy cleaning and to facilitate maintenance.
Outer openings of a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall be protected against the entry of insects and rodents. Unless otherwise allowed by law.
violationsByInspectionidList.problemDescription: Not sealed to prevent pest entry

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: Exhaust ventilation hood systems in FOOD preparation and WAREWASHING areas including components such as hoods, fans, guards, and ducting shall be designed to prevent grease or condensation from draining or dripping onto FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES.
violationsByInspectionidList.problemDescription: Designed to allow grease or condensation from draining/dripping onto

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: NonFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of EQUIPMENT shall be cleaned at a frequency necessary to preclude accumulation of soil residues.

(A) In FOOD ESTABLISHMENTS in which cleaning methods other than water flushing are used for cleaning floors, the floor and wall junctures shall be coved and closed to no larger than one thirty-second inch.
(B) The floors in FOOD ESTABLISHMENTS in which water flush cleaning methods are used shall be provided with drains and be graded to drain, and the floor and wall junctures shall be coved and SEALED.
